page.title: 12Wheatley Hill Traffic Survey
page.content: On June 3rd 1985 we carried out a traffic survey in{Front Street.}We started at{13.32}and ended at{14.02.} The most common vehicle was the car but there were many lorries as well. This was probably due to the fact that many of the council houses are being altered and the lorries are delivering materials. There were no large articulated lorries because these use the main road on the edge of the village. Of the{112 cars}we spotted, 29 were 'A'registered. Only a few of them were more than nine years old. {The buses}that passed were going to {Durham, Hartlepool and Sunderland.} None of the twelve buses in the survey had more than nine passengers. Most people seem to travel by car.
